Course Description: THIS COURSE PRESENTS FUNDAMENTAL PRINCIPLES AND PROCEDURES OF RECORDING, CLASSIFYING, AND SUMMARIZING FINANCIAL DATA AND INCLUDES ACCRUALS AND DEFERRALS, DEPRECIATION, INVENTORY, PAYROLL, CASH CONTROL, AND NOTES PAYABLE.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
AT THE COMPLETION OF THE COURSE, THE STUDENT WILL BE ABLE TO:
1.  PROCESS DOUBLE-ENTRY ACCOUNTING ENTRIES
2.  IDENTIFY AND EXPLAIN THE ACCOUNTING CYCLE
3.  PREPARE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
4.  CALCULATE AND JOURNALIZE ENTRIES INVOLVING DEPRECIATION, INVENTORY, CASH CONTROL, INTEREST ON NOTES, ACCRUALS AND DEFERRALS, AND YEAR END ADJUSTMENTS
5.  CONTINUE WITH THE STUDY OF ACG 2011.
Textbook(s): FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING BY WARREN REEVE FESS, SOUTH-WESTERN PUBLISHING CO., CINN.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
